dmca.title: [Fwd: [ABUSE] Subject: Stolen page copy is not only a violation of copyright, but can
dmca.body:
To Whom It May Concern:

Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does not
substantially comply with the required notification elements of the Digital
Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA").

Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your claim.

Please visit our web site at www.theplanet.com/legal.
 
Legal Response Team
THEPLANET.COM INTERNET SERVICES, INC.

-----Original Message-----
From: abuseadm@theplanet.com [mailto:abuseadm@theplanet.com] On Behalf Of
The Planet Policy Enforcement
Sent: Monday, March 06, 2006 3:17 PM
To: webmaster@joanofquark.com; copyright@theplanet.com
Subject: [Fwd: [ABUSE] Subject: Stolen page copy is not only a violation of
copyright, but can get both of us banned by the search engines for duplicate
page content.]

-----BEGIN PGP SIGNED MESSAGE-----
Hash: SHA1

Your email is being forwarded on to our Copyright counsel for review, at the
address of copyright@theplanet.com.

- -------- Original Message --------
Subject:         [ABUSE] Subject: Stolen page copy is not only a violation of
copyright, but can get both of us banned by the search engines for duplicate
page content.
Date:         Mon, 6 Mar 2006 11:13:38 -0800
From:         JoanOfQuark <webmaster@joanofquark.com>
Reply-To:         webmaster@joanofquark.com
To:         <sales@theplanet.com>
CC:         marketing@theplanet.com, abuse@theplanet.com



It has come to our attention that your website,
http://www.looklogodesign.com/ <http://www.alibinali.com/> , is using
material copied verbatim (from our website, www.joanofquark.com (the
"Property") in spite of the fact that it is obviously our intellectual
property.  As you know or should know, such misappropriation and use in
competitive commerce of our intellectual property is a clear violation of
the copyright laws of the United States of America and the unfair
competition and predatory trade practices laws of both the United States of
America and the State of California.  Demand is hereby made that you and
your affiliates immediately cease and desist from any further use of the
Property and that you promptly deliver to us duly executed and notarized
affidavits which represent under penalty of perjury that all such use has
ceased and that you and your affiliates will hereafter forever desist from
any such use or any other use of any of our other intellectual property.



            You have already subjected yourself and any companies and
individuals, who have at any time designed, provided servers for,
transmitted and/or hosted your website, operating or otherwise involved in
such illegal acts to liability for damages (including statutory treble and
other damages, legal interest, court costs and reimbursement of attorney?s
fees).

If you fail to immediately comply with the demands made in this letter, we
will begin putting such other companies and individuals with whom you do
business on notice of the illegality or your and their conduct - and you
will increase such liability by clearly establishing wilful misconduct,
including the possibility of punitive damages, as well as the possibility of
cross-complaints for indemnity against liability and legal expenses from
such other companies and individuals.



            If you think that your location will in any way insulate you
from such legal action, we urge you to think again.  Our litigation counsel
tell us that they expect no difficulty obtaining jurisdiction over you in
this matter in both the Federal and State courts located in Los Angeles.





            Furthermore, you should be aware of the stance by search engines
such as Google and others concerning these practices and be further advised
that you are in breach of your agreement with the search engines. We have
already benefited from our successful steps in having similar sites removed
from Yahoo, Google and MSN, pursuant to the/ ?_Digital Millennium Copyright
Act_?. /Should you not cease using our copy immediately, be advised that *we
will do our utmost to have your site banned from the search engines as well.
//*



We await your compliance and reply.

Respectfully

Ira Blacker

Webmaster





CC:

S.D. Ashley Esq.





* *


- --
Thanks,

Policy Enforcement
The Planet Internet Services, Inc.
http://www.theplanet.com/legal/aup.html
-----BEGIN PGP SIGNATURE-----

Comment: Using GnuPG with Mozilla - http://enigmail.mozdev.org
